cvs.name: Decoder Brand Identifier
cvs.description:
Number identifying the decoder brand.
Common brand id:
36: RailConnect	48: Hornby		62: Tams Electronik
99: Lenz		101: Bachmann	151: ESU
155:Fleischmann	161: Roco

cvs.name: Analog Mode for F1-F8
cvs.description: CV 13 is a bitwise CV, where each bit allows you to control the function in analog mode.

cvs.name: Analog Mode for F0, F9-F12
cvs.description: CV 19 is a bitwise CV, where each bit allows you to control the function in analog mode.

cvs.name: MU Address
cvs.description: This CV can be used to assign a second primary address to a locomotive for use in a consist, or "MU" arrangement

cvs.name: MU F1-F8
cvs.description: CV 21 is a bitwise CV, where each bit allows you to control the function in multiple unit mode.

cvs.name: MU F0, F9-F12
cvs.description: CV 19 is a bitwise CV, where each bit allows you to control the function in multiple unit mode

cvs.name: Acceleration Time (MU only)
cvs.description: This CV contains additional acceleration rate information that is to be added to or subtracted from the base value contained in CV3. Only usefull if CV19 is not 0

cvs.name: Deceleration Time (MU only)
cvs.description: This CV contains additional deceleration rate information that is to be added to or subtracted from the base value contained in CV4. Only usefull if CV19 is not 0

cvs.name: ABC system
cvs.description: This CV is used to configure ABC system will be used. Value might be different depending on the brand. Refer to the decoder documentation.

cvs.name: Configuration Register
cvs.description: Bit field controlling core decoder behavior (direction, speed steps, addressing, etc.).
